chargeHist.descr: Tampering with a Global Positioning System Tracking Device

result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott P. Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Attempting to Flee/Elude Traffic Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Proposed Order Denying Motion

(Case called at 9:29 AM)  All parties for this hearing appear via the Zoom video application.
Defendant Scott Olson appears in custody from Kettle Moraine Correctional Facility without counsel.  Attorney Emmeline Lee appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant calls Nicholas Layland (Defendant's attorney at sentencing hearing) to testify- sworn by clerk.  Defendant waives his privilege to attorney/client confidentiality.  Attorney Layland testifies.  State cross-examines Attorney Layland.  Re-direct by Defendant of Attorney Layland.  Re-cross by State.  Attorney Layland is excused.  Parties make arguments to support written submissions.  Court denies Defendant's motion- State to draft order for the Court to sign.

Motion hearing on February 3, 2021 at 09:30 am.

Defendant's Motion to Supplement Postconviction Motion with attached proposed exhibit.   Pursuant to the Supreme Courts Order issued 4/13/2020, this document is deemed filed 12/07/2020 because that is the date it was mailed.

(Case called at 08:58 AM- all parties for this hearing appear via Zoom) Defendant Scott P. Olson appears in custody from Kettle Moraine Correctional without counsel. Attorney Emmeline Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant's Motion for postconviction relief. State requests more information regarding Defendant's specific claims regarding requesting to be resentenced. Defendant indicates he is making mockner type claim. Court indicates the Attorney needs to be available to testify for a mockner hearing. Defendant makes argument for resentencing. State denies that the Defendant has made sufficient claims- makes argument. Defendant makes rebuttal argument. 
Court finds no new factors and denies motion based on new factors. Court orders Defendant to file a new motion regarding ineffective assistance of counsel, State has 2 weeks to file response- Branch 1 Judicial Assistant will schedule Motion Hearing after all paperwork is filed.
IT IS ORDERED that Olson's erroneously filed notice of intent to seek postconviction relief does not affect his pending sentence modification motion. (Order dated December 4, 2020)
